Installing siteinterlock

PyPI

To install siteinterlock, just execute 

pip install siteinterlock

Alternatively, you download the package manually from the Python Package Index https://pypi.python.org/pypi/siteinterlock, unzip it, navigate into the package, and use the command:

python setup.py install
Upgrading via pip

To upgrade an existing version of siteinterlock from PyPI, execute

pip install siteinterlock --upgrade --no-deps

Please note that the dependencies (NumPy and SciPy) will also be upgraded if you omit the --no-deps flag; use the --no-deps ("no dependencies") flag if you don't want this.

Dev Version

The siteinterlock version on PyPI may always one step behind; you can install the latest development version from the GitHub repository by executing

pip install git+git://github.com/rasbt/siteinterlock.git

Or, you can fork the GitHub repository from https://github.com/rasbt/siteinterlock and install siteinterlock from your local drive via

python setup.py install

Anaconda/Conda

Conda packages are now available for Mac, Windows, and Linux. You can install siteinterlock using conda by executing

conda install -c rasbt siteinterlock
